article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10jgyBc hentry entry story-marquee-standard

h2.a: That Internet War Apocalypse Is A Lie

div.p: You might've read some headlines today saying that there's an online attack underway. The biggest in history. Enough to slow down the internet. This would be exciting and scary, except it's just not true.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13xzliz hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: NYPD's All-Star Stop-And-Friskers Explain How To Get Stop-And-Frisked

div.p: If you're looking to get stopped and searched by police officers, here's a few helpful hints.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14wmrRn hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Egypt Catches Divers Cutting Vital Internet Cable

div.p: Egypt's coastguard caught three divers cutting through an undersea Internet cable on Wednesday, the army said, the first suggestion criminals might be involved in days of severed connections and disruptions online.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-13yrvoZ hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: Journalist Takes Truck For Test Drive, Truck Burns To A Crisp In 3 Minutes

div.p: "For a few hours last week, my copper-colored Ram pickup cruised the plains of North Texas like some overdressed Duke of Dallas...it all disappeared in a thick column of acrid brown smoke on the side of the Dallas North Tollway â€” $54,335 worth of truck gone in about three minutes."

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10QqOmV hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Watch This Enormous Ship Being Built In Just 76 Seconds

div.p: The Maersk Triple E-class ships are both enormous and energy efficient. Here you can see one getting put together over two months, compressed into just a few seconds.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-WWIM5S hentry entry story-col-1

h2.a: Explore The Fukushima Nuclear Exclusion Zone With Google Street View

div.p: No-one has lived in the town of Namie, Japan for over two years since it was evacuated following the nearby Fukushima nuclear disaster, but you can visit for yourself today with Google Street View.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-YJoKt5 hentry entry story-col-2

h2.a: The Only Thing You Need To Read About The Supreme Court's Prop 8 Arguments

div.p: Yesterday, the Supreme Court heard arguments from either side of the polarizing Californian Prop 8, which defines marriage as between a man and woman. Here are the highlights you need to know.

h2.a: Quentin Tarantino Is Sweet, But He Can't Spell For Sh*t

div.p: On the occasion of Quentin Tarantino's 50th birthday the always-awesome Letters Of Note has re-promoted a letter that the director sent to a fan back in 1996.

h2.a: Florida's War On Bongs Has Arrived

div.p: Lawmakers in Florida, the state which actually eats its residents via sinkholes, have decided that it wants to ban the sale bongs.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-14sGXT9 hentry entry story-col-2

header.div: SOMEHOW LESS SCARY THAN REGULAR SHARK

h2.a: Two-Headed Shark Found By Fisherman

div.p: A fisherman working off the Florida Keys recently caught a bull shark, then opened it up to find that it contained two live fetuses, including one highly unusual one with two heads.

h2.a: This Is How You Get To A Wedding In Gaza

div.p: Egyptian bride Manal Abu Shanar took an unusual route to her wedding in the Gaza Strip: a smuggler's tunnel.

article.class: story-container digg-story-el story-10eaj0s hentry entry story-col-0

h2.a: Fighting Cancer With The Google PageRank Algorithm

div.p: Metastasis is when cancer cells break off of the primary tumor to surf the bloodstream and set up shop in new organs and body areas. Thankfully, researchers are developing a new way to combat this life-and-death variety of hide-and-go-seek, a strategy borrowed from one of the best dang seekers around.
